channel.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming

item.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

Yes thats right,

And yes, it only hits me when its on another player. They also do the emote, and deal damage on me. Even though they aren’t wielding them.

item.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I’m assuming if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49){ specialAtk(false, 50, 600, 6000); AttackingOn2.dclaws = 4; dclaws = 4; specOn = false; AttackingOn2.DclawDamg1 = misc.random(Math.round(((playerMaxHit)*20)/15)); } is for players and if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49) { specialAtkNPC(true, 50, 600, 6000); hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit + 20); } is for npcs?

I think the problem is hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit + 20);

Is it hitting you too when you attack a player or just when you attack an npc?

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49){ specialAtk(false, 50, 600, 6000); AttackingOn2.dclaws = 4; dclaws = 4; specOn = false; AttackingOn2.DclawDamg1 = misc.random(Math.round(((playerMaxHit)*20)/15)); }

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49) { specialAtkNPC(true, 50, 600, 6000); hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit + 20); }

item.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Put it at login; your initialize() method. Process() calls every 500ms. Meaning every 500ms, if your warning is 1, 2, 3, etc. then it’ll send you a message every 500ms.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mark message keeps spamming
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

[code]if (warning == 1) {
sM(“You currently have 1 out of 6 Black Marks. Dont gain more, or be muted or banned.”);
}
if (warning == 2) {
sM(“You currently have 2 out of 6 Black Marks. Dont gain more, or be muted or banned.”);
}
if (warning == 3){
writeLog(playerName,“mutes”);
disconnected = true;
sM(“You are now in the @red@ RED ZONE! With 3 of 6 Black marks. @bla@Because of this, you’re now muted”);
}
if (warning == 4) {
sM(“You currently have 4 out of 6 Black Marks. Dont gain more, or be banned.”);
}
if (warning == 5) {
sM(“You currently have 5 out of 6 Black Marks. One more and you will be banned.”);
}
if (warning == 6){

		writeLog(playerName, "bans");
		disconnected = true;

}[/code]

This tell’s them how many black marks they have. But it keeps spamming them, should I use else if, and should I put it on login, instead of process()

Thanks,
wwe4eva

Read full topic
